page.title: 01Introduction to Hankham area
page.content: The main centre of population in the area is the{Village of Hankham}.The majority of the land is farmed and consists to a large extent of low lying marshland.Isolated farms are scattered throughout the area with the occasional small cluster of dwellings. The higher sections of farmland are used for cereal production.Most of the low lying land is used for sheep grazing.There is a group of medium sized dairy farms which remain in defiance of the squeeze felt by the introduction of E.E.C.milk quotas. The low lying Pevensey Levels are crossed by only a few roads which means that disturbance of field life is kept at a minimum.This area remains free from flooding because of a drainage system maintained and operated by Southern Water Authority.{
